Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2010 03:38AM pbandj wrote: I was in the post office one day and had my 2 dd's one was around 4 and the other 3.  The 3 year old was being really loud.  I quietly whispered in her ear that she needed to use her "use your quiet voice.".  To which she yelled "I don't have a quiet voice!"  I swear you could have heard her a block away.  It was totally embarrassing at the time but, now I find it very funny.
Posts.Title: Bring a smile, or share a laugh Fitztwins china

Posts.Content: pbandj wrote: First I wanted to get advice on a christmas present.  It is much more fun.  For my in-laws have been terrific to me through all this cancer crap and I found a way to pay then back withh a fun christmas present.  There is a comical theater I want to send them to.  I can either buy season tickets (5 shows) with no dinner/lunch really or 2 different times with lunch/dinner.  Which do you think is best?  Why or why not?  Also many have asked about brain tumors.  I resently bit the bullet and had 2  brain tumors removed after 1 wbr and 2 radio static thing.  I must say for me surgery all be it brain surgery was easier than I thought.  Thanks In Advance 7/3/08 diagnosed at age 32 stage IV grade 3 er-/pr- her2/neu+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: chritmas present advice and update pbandj 3littlegirls

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 07:32PM pbandj wrote: I am a bit older than you currently but, not too far from your age when I was dx with stage 4 at that time it was bone mets only.  Bone mets for me were helped with radiation and pain pills.  I also stopped lifting heavy items.  On the attitude and not being down.  Face it you will be down at times no matter your dx.  Cancer sucks.  That is o.k. take a day or week and cry it out.  Then find that one thing or person that you love and cannot live without doing or being with and hold onto that.  For me it is my dh and 4 kiddos.  Also, you may want to look into depression meds they can help as well.  Personally I take them and find no shame in that.  Sometimes you need all the help you can get to make it.  Check and see if there are any retreats in your area to go to.  I did that and it helped incredibly.  Everyone there was stage 4.  If you cannot find one send me a pm and I will get you the website.

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2010 02:08AM pbandj wrote: It will depend on the tumors themselves what they do. In my case they started with whole brain raditation.  After that they did a more targeted raditiation.  There are some chemo treatments that do cross the blood brain barrier as well so that I would not let them rule out just yet.  Best wishes on your scans.

Posts.Title: KBugmom konakat Makratz

Posts.Content: pbandj wrote: O.k I should probably introduce myself to you for those of you who have not met in the chat rooms.  I am a 33 year old mother of 4 kiddos ages 3-9.  I was dx in July of 2009.  I was stage 4 from the beginning due to bone mets in my spine (l1,l2) (stats for those who like to know er/pr- her2+ grade3) I did 4 rounds of ac w/zometa, 12 rounds of taxol w, zometa and herceptin. had a bilateral mast. taken off herceptin for a time due a drop in ejection fraction.  Resumed herception....all the while continued zometa.  Did 30 zaps of chest radiation cannot remember how many boosts.  A spine radiation.  Finished herceptin in August tenatively while awaiting scans.  Had a exchange surgery the day after my last herceptin. A week later while my drains were still in had a pet scan.  Results came back good.  Tumor in spine was stable it had not changed since last pet scan.  I could stop herceptin for a time.  So, now just zometa.  Things were looking good...... but, alas that was short lived.  I was able to enjoy a nice holiday season and feel good with my family then it seems the new year hit.  And I all of the sudden started to feel horrible.  My headaches started, I lost my energy, I lost feeling in my hands, feet and lips.  Longer story short.  I got my MRI results back from my onc.'s PA yesterday (onc is out on maternity leave right now).  I do not know a lot of the details.   She called when I was in the middle of Walmart.  So I tried to get to an isle that was a little less crowded when she asked if I was somewhere I could "talk".  At at that point I knew it wasn't good but, I wasn't in a position to leave the shopping cart full of things for dinner either.  So I forced myself to hold it together.  I wasn't able to remember or hear as many of the details as I would like either.  I know she told me that the MRI showed to area's for sure but, she sent the results to my radiation oncologist to look over in case she missed anything.  She wants me to start raditiation asap.  She called in a script for a steriod to start last night to help with swelling.  I asked about chemo and she mentioned probably started herceptin back up not sure about what else or when??  So I feel like what I did digest seems like now I have more questions than answers and I did some searching on the internet.  I know that is a bad thing to do.  Really bad.  What I found led me to believe that for her2 positive cancer that has went to the brain there may not be a lot of chemo that will even help.  Please someone reasurre me that I am just reading all this info wrong?  And that I am reading this info wrong on prognosis cause all of that is really really horrible too.  Don't get me wrong I know brain mets is bad but, 3 or 4 months even with treatment I do not buy that.  That just cannot be.  I know when I asked the onc. about she kinda danced around that but, she seemed quite a bit more hopefull than that.  She said it was more serious that the original dx but, definately was not giving me a death date. 7/3/08 diagnosed at age 32 stage IV grade 3 er-/pr- her2/neu+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: need reassurance brain mets her2+ pr/er-_ pbandj tami444

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2010 03:24PM pbandj wrote: I am not too concerned with the PA being the one "in charge" so to speak because at the hospital which is also a research center where I am treated I know there is a cancer board that meets a minimum of once a week more if needed.  It consists of all of many surgeon's, nurses, oncologists and such and they go over recomendations for all the patients in that department/specialty.  I know from a phone call I got this morning that she has already consulted with my radiation oncologist beacuse I have an appt with him followed by a treatment/planning session tomorrow.  Which based on previous expirence tells me is a casting session and such.  Which means radiation will be sometime early next week.
Posts.Title: need reassurance brain mets her2+ pr/er-_ pbandj tami444

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2010 09:52AM pbandj wrote: I feel a bit better today.  I had a appt. with the raditaion onc. yesterday as well as a treatment planning session.  After some discussion I will be doing whole brain radiation first.  Then a targeted approach on the two areas after that sbrt I think.  (I cannot remember I have had the same thing done on my spine though).  Then this will be repeated with any other things that may pop up as we go along.  I questioned why this approach and am confident as to the why and how.  It makes sense to me and really that is what matters.  On a side note my radtiation oncologist is the head of his department and one of the best dr. in the area and does come very highly recomended inside the medical establishment and outside it as well so I do trust him a lot.  He also seemed much more positive than I expected about things.  I guess I was expecting gloom and doom.  But, he was always more gloom and doom than my onc. ever was anyway.  Not that he was real happer either.  Sorry babbling.   Anyway first treatment is today.  Wow! That was quick.
